```{r, message = FALSE}
# Load libraries
library(tidyverse)
library(ggplot2)
library(stringr)
source("helper.R")
```

```{r}
# Read in raw data from the OCCP survey. These are the files downloaded from survey monkey saved as a .csv
raw_data_occp <- read.csv("data/occp_ma.csv", stringsAsFactors = FALSE)
```

```{r}
# Pull out all responses for Q49 (a single selection question) combine, then determine 'question n'
Q49 <- "What.impact.do.you.think.legalization.will.have.on.youth.consumption.of.cannabis."

Q49_all <- get_single_selection(data = raw_data_occp, q.name = Q49)

number_of_people <- length(unique(Q49_all$id))
```

```{r}
# Manipulate data into a graphable format
Q49_plot <- 
  Q49_all %>%
  group_by(response) %>%
  summarize(count = n()) %>%
  mutate(percent_all = count / sum(count)) %>%
  mutate(percent_responded = count / number_of_people)
```

```{r}
# Plot with percents and response counts
r <- 
  ggplot(Q49_plot, aes(x = reorder(response, count), y = percent_responded)) +
  geom_bar(stat = 'identity') +
  coord_flip() +
  geom_text(aes(label= paste(round(percent_responded, 2), count, sep = "***")))

r
```

```{r}
# Save graph as PNG, plot data as csv, and all question data including response IDs as csv (save question n and N at end of plot file as "_x.x")
ggsave(filename = 'OCCP_Q49_Legalization_Youth.png', plot = r, device = 'png')

write.csv(Q49_plot, 'OCCP_Q49_Legalization_Youth_900.900.csv', row.names = FALSE)

write.csv(Q49_all, 'Responses_ID.csv', row.names = FALSE)
```
